definition: used of the language of the deaf, structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted, make the sign of the cross over someone in order to call on God for protection
details:
adjective
- used of the language of the deaf
= synonyms: sign-language
noun
- structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted
= example: structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted
= synonyms: signboard
- a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened
= example: a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened
= synonyms: mark
- any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
= example: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
= synonyms: signal
- a public display of a message
= example: a public display of a message
- a character indicating a relation between quantities
= example: a character indicating a relation between quantities
- a gesture that is part of a sign language
- a fundamental linguistic unit linking a signifier to that which is signified
= example: a fundamental linguistic unit linking a signifier to that which is signified
- an event that is experienced as indicating important things to come
= synonyms: augury, foretoken, preindication
- (astrology) one of 12 equal areas into which the zodiac is divided
= synonyms: house
- having an indicated pole (as the distinction between positive and negative electric charges)
= synonyms: polarity
- any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease
= example: any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease
verb
- make the sign of the cross over someone in order to call on God for protection
= synonyms: bless
- be engaged by a written agreement
= example: be engaged by a written agreement
- communicate in sign language
= example: communicate in sign language
- mark with one's signature
= synonyms: autograph, subscribe, inscribe
- communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
= example: communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
= synonyms: signal
- place signs, as along a road
= example: place signs, as along a road
- engage by written agreement
= example: engage by written agreement
= synonyms: contract
- approve and express assent, responsibility, or obligation
= synonyms: ratify
